name: Redcastle Hotel

reviews.text: Second time staying at Redcastle. This trip was with my 4 month old son. It was an ideal break for us with a few families about, so we felt comfortable with a baby. Pool was great, we went during kids hours so lively. My husband and I stayed here 7 years ago and enjoyed the pool and spa during the adult only hours. On this trip we still felt like we were in a spa hotel which comfortably allowed children. Our package included dinner which was very nice. Buffet breakfast was sufficient. Very nice walk along sea from moville to greencastle. Only complaint was no AC during very hot weather, but remote location allowed windows to be left open.
reviews.title: good for young family

reviews.text: Recently stayed 1 night for a break with 2 friends midweek. We booked 1 night b&b with spa treatments & an evening meal which we were all really looking forward too. On booking my friend asked for a room for the 3 of us but was told they didn't have a room suitable but we could have a suite & an extra bed would be put in room for us. My friend did confirm that it would not be a camp bed, which the receptionist confirmed it was not. So we booked our spa treatments the week before, first treatment at 2pm but on arrival we were told we could not check in to our room until 3pm even though they knew we had treatments from 2pm and it was hardly busy. Hotel setting is lovely but there is very little to do in the area. We eventually got key for room at 2.45 which was large and looked recently decorated but surprise surprise there was a camp bed! Duty manager was sent up to meet us in the room after we complained to reception but his attitude was very unprofessional even though we pointed out that the bed was too small for an adult, not enough towels etc. The room was a bit grubby including bathroom shower tiles, toilet etc. Housekeeping staff were asked to sort out a decent bed by manager which they did with an attitude. As for the spa its not sound proofed so you can hear everything outside the treatment rooms including screaming children. We were given shabby, discoloured gowns that didn't fit any of us and when we went to use the pool/sauna area it was full of kids in for swimming lessons. Female changing room was packed with kids including young boys (7+), who to us were old enough to use male changing area. No privacy! Definitely not a spa hotel and apart from a few members, staff were very unprofessional, cheeky & over familiar. Evening meal was good & the waiter was lovely but the dinning room is shabby & dated. The bar area has no atmosphere & we ended up sitting in lobby with our drinks. Would not recommend this hotel for relaxing spa treatments & definitely not up to 4 star hotel standard.
reviews.title: Definitely not 4 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really lovely hotel, I think this is the third time we have stayed and I should think we will be back in the very near future. The pool is excellent and although the hotel was very busy we were lucky enough to get the pool to ourselves and it was glorious. There were quite a few families with young children but it was very quiet. The rooms are very comfortable and even though our room was on what they called 1st basement we still had a beautiful view of Lough Foyle. The food was excellent and of course we ate much to much but enjoyed every mouthful. The staff are very helpful and helped to make our stay perfect.
reviews.title: A wee Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was only one thing missing - entertainment . As there isn't much round Redcastle, the nearest village is Moville about 4miles away it would be good if there was some entertainment that you could enjoy after dining, but that's the only thing missing at this hotel.
reviews.title: love this place

reviews.text: i stayed here on the 14th july for 2nights b&b and 1 dinner with my hubby i stay here at least once a year the staff here cant do enough for you and any time i go the place is booked out so they are catering for alot of people.
reviews.title: Wedding - beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and i booked 3 nights here, we stayed 5 ! The reception staff were magnificent throughout our stay and very helpfull with no language barriers. On arrival the butler helped us with our bags and explained all the essentials on our way to our room. Our room was amazing the best we have ever been in throughout Europe! The breakfast was lovely and the evening meal included in our deal was first class. The restaurant staff are excellent and very attentive, the bar staff were very nice also.
reviews.title: Cruise Like

reviews.text: We stayed here and it was an awful experience. The hotel manager didn't want to deal with one of our parties complaints and didn't leave the breakfast room to speak to us. The nightclub will keep you up all night and the general cleanliness of the hotel was poor. Should not be 4*.also do not go by staff recommendations for restaurants we walked out of both places we were told were good.

reviews.text: Just back from a lovely mid week break at this hotel. The hotel and grounds are beautifully maintained. The food was first class and the staff very pleasant and so helpful, nothing was to much bother for them. The location breathtaking, the Spa wonderful I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking a relaxing break and good food.

description: A warm Irish welcome awaits you at the four star Redcastle Oceanfront, Golf & Spa Hotel. With a magical waterfront location, overlooking Lough Foyle on the picturesque Inishowen Peninsula in Donegal, it’s the perfect getaway for a short break or family holiday at home.Set among mature woodland with 93 guest rooms including suites and family rooms and sea view rooms, our own 9-hole parkland golf course and exclusive Thalasso Spa, the Resort oozes charm, style and warm hospitality. Our Waters Edge Restaurant is appropriately named with breathtaking views across Lough Foyle and a menu that features the finest local seafood and fare.
